findings.title: Reentrancy via ERC777-style token callback in borrow()
findings.description: The borrow() function transfers AMP tokens before updating the debt state. AMP implements transfer hooks that call tokensReceived() on the recipient, allowing reentrancy before debt is recorded.
findings.impact: Attacker can borrow multiple times against the same collateral, draining the pool.
findings.recommendation: Update debt state before external token transfer (CEI pattern).
